content: Hmmm, I just checked my Thunderebird version - it's 140.4.0. It's the latest version, AND was automatically installed yesterday, which is exactly when this login problem started happening. So, was this a super coincidence, or was the update the cause of the problem????
creator: Don-Peters

content:
Don Peters said
or was the update the cause of the problem????

Probably not. It is far more likely you have what amounts to fairly standard post update problems with your antivirus product of choice. Only Defender, that I know of, is exempt and it does not scan email.

This is an exceeding common issues with the leading antivirus brands from Gen Digital

Check the firewall component. Go to addons and themes on Thunderbird menu and search for import. Does it return a load of results (I get 40) of some cryptic error message.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Unless you created a Primary Password for Thunderbird, the desired password is for the account. If you post a screenshot of the message, that may help.

content: Well, we don't know what solutions you attempted. To verify the fundamentals, I suggest testing with a plain text sig. If that works as intended, then the next thing to look at would be the HTML itself.
creator: davidsk

content:
Thanks for your reply David,

The other solutions posted on this forum involved deselecting the include signature on replies option, then sending an email and then reselecting the option and sending again.

Plain text signature doesn't work either. Signatures only appear on new emails. With a HTML file signature, you can see it for a split second, but then it disappears. I believe it is putting the signature but then it wipes it for some reason.

I've used the same HMTL file for 4 years. First time any problems.
creator: office920

content: Puzzling. The fact that plain text doesn't work indicates there may be something unique to your setup, as we would be inundated if this was happening universally. Try using troubleshoot mode (help>troubleshoot mode) and see if sig works then. Try with plain text sig and with HTML sig.
creator: davidsk

content:
HI David

Sorted it! Everything worked perfectly in Troubleshoot mode. So this told me it was probably an Add-on that was causing the issue. I looked at my Add-on list, disabled Signature Switch, and that solved it. Thanks for the heads up!
creator: office920

content: Thanks for the feedback. I felt that was a likely cause. I was glad to assist. :) TIP: If you do need to periodically use a different signature, the 'Manage Identities' button on the account pane lets you set up multiple signatures, each of which can be selected in the FROM drop-down menu.
creator: davidsk

content:
are they in your Thunderbird address book? is that address book selected in your account settings as a white list for junk processing? If both of those things are yes, then the issue is not Thunderbird.

It might be your antivirus product of choice. Some of them consider themselves competent to mange your spam for you. Mostly poorly as they don't look at your contacts in making their decisions.

It might also be you mail provider. Most have some sort of active SPAM filtering happening. Big players like Yahoo and Microsoft\Outlook\Hotmail\MSN\live refer to your contacts as a white list, but as a general rule there are no, or few, contacts in the online mail account as all sending and addressing is done in the mail client. Microsoft are doing a job of forcing all your personal data into their cloud, so the absent contacts are not as prevalent there as they used to be. Well mine are because I don't play nicely with the Microsoft Agenda for online cloud storage of sensitive data, but most folk fall into line.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
When I send mails I get an error that the email was sent but it was not possible to save it in the "sent" folder and I get the option to save it in the local "sent" folder

I receive the email when checking my email on my Android phone but never receive the new email in Thunderbird!?
creator: clarkknosen

content:
1. No idea. A very very long time on Dial-up internet months or years possibly. Minutes if you were connected to a fibre backbone. The speed and quality of your connection are critical. Phrased as you have, I could ask you how long it takes to drive from Durbin to Paris. There are a load of variables in both cases and no simple answer.

2. Are you talking about getting you mail or something about installing. I do not understand I don't think. POP email are downloaded one at a time and a record of the server reference for that mail is kept. One of the issues with flaky connections is the same mails may be downloaded over and over as the fetch restarts at the last recorded position after failure.

3. No. The term in the specification is "mail drop" at a practical level most providers use what they call the inbox as the mail drop for POP accounts. But technically the mail drop should include all incoming mail including spam and many providers do not offer that with POP instead offering a sanitised inbox style

4. Complete garbage. The connection is usually to the same server using the same wires and the same encryption. Security in this is not specific to protocol. A poorly secured mail server will be just a poorly configured regardless of the protocol you use to fetch your mail for reading.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
If I delete items in the junk folder every so often (I had 2,000 junk emails in there at one point and then deleted it), does this negate the Thunderbird identifying items as junk mail?

No, it does not. You don't want to accumulate spam messages forever. Also see https://support.mozilla.org/kb/thunderbird-and-junk-spam-messages

What should I be doing with the junk mail once it is in the junk folder?

I'd leave it there for a while, so you've got time to check for any false positives (or negatives). Then you can let Thunderbird automatically delete spam messages in the Junk folder, e.g. after 14 days.

At the top right of the Thunderbird window, click the menu button ≡ > Account Settings > Junk Settings > Destination and Retention. Check 'Automatically delete junk mail older than x days'.
